title: Sequence counters and sequential locks — The Linux Kernel  documentation

last_post.content:
update: someone pointed out that "transactional mutex locks" look a lot like the linux kernel's seqlocks https://docs.kernel.org/locking/seqlock.html

title: Exploring the training data behind Stable Diffusion

last_post.content: Using YouTube IDs in a dataset like this rather than including the full clip is actually a pretty common pattern in machine learning - the LAION dataset used to train Stable Diffusion and Midjourney is similar, it's a big file of metadata but the images themselves are just URLs to publicly hosted images, as @andybaio and I described in our investigation of how that all worked last year: https://simonwillison.net/2022/Sep/5/laion-aesthetics-weeknotes/

"The text that I read in these dashboards is image-free for now. And I think it’s having a calming effect. There are plenty of times when I want images, don’t get me wrong. But there are times when I want to dial down the clutter, just like there are times when I switch my phone to monochrome."

https://blog.jonudell.net/2023/01/26/images-considered-harmful-sometimes/

[this image intentionally omitted]

title: Big Tech was moving cautiously on AI. Then came ChatGPT.

last_post.content:
For years, tech giants like Google and Facebook have been developing the underlying tech behind tools like ChatGPT and Stable Diffusion--but had been cautious about releasing them due to concerns over safety, bias, and misinfo.

Now, with tech stocks tumbling and ChatGPT hype soaring, insiders say there's growing pressure to stop listening to the ethicists and cassandras and charge ahead despite the risks. New from @nitashatiku, Gerrit De Vynck and me: https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2023/01/27/chatgpt-google-meta/

title: Earthlike planets should readily form around other stars, meteorites suggest

last_post.content:
This was a fun, if tricky, story to tell: Meteoritic clues suggest that Earth-like planets may be much easier to build -- and so more common -- than we once thought.

It was long thought that to get the water and volatiles needed to make Earth, those elements had to be delivered from the outer solar system. But those ingredients appear to have been close at hand -- and probably are in other solar systems, as well.

https://www.science.org/content/article/earthlike-planets-should-readily-form-around-other-stars-meteorites-suggest

New preprint "Patterns of within-host spread of Chlamydia trachomatis between vagina, endocervix and rectum revealed by comparative genomic analysis"

We used an Agilent bait library to pull #Chlamydia trachomatis #genomes directly from clinical samples. Found in some cases highly similar bacteria from simultaneously samples sites in the same person. In some cases, strong evidence of multiple strains present. Theses data are complex though!

Last April rockets struck a paediatric hospital and shopping precinct in the Ukrainian city of Mykolaiv, killing a dozen people.

Following a trail of open source clues led us to videos of a missile launch and a burn mark in a field near the Inhulets River — that is, to an area of Ukraine which was at the time under Russian occupation.

last_post.content:
Our users — other staff — didn't even know that there was an AI / ML component. That had two ways to use the tool: ingest and search. Ingest allowed them to upload files or paste urls and our weird bots took it from there. Search was search. Media was returned with transcript, links back to source material, and relevant people, locations, and organizations tagged. I spoke a bit about this during my CampaignTech Innovation Summit keynote² in November. #PoliticalTech 3/

title: Collisionless dynamics of general non-Fermi liquids from hydrodynamics of emergent conserved quantities

last_post.content: Today's #arXivsummary: https://arxiv.org/abs/2301.10775 by Dominic V. Else. Author shows that an infinite-dimensional emergent symmetry group has very strong implications for the dynamics of strongly-coupled metals. Hydrodynamic prediction that within the low-T, collisionless regime, the dynamics and response to external fields of a general spinless metal will be identical to a Fermi liquid. #CondMat #StrEl #arXiv_2301_10775
